title: (x) Northcode logo - Helvetica (customized) {Marc O}
content:
Anyone know the font from the northcode logo here:   
   
 ![northcode logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121162656im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/37448.jpg)   
   
I've searched for a lot of Bauhaus inspired faces, but none were quite right.   
   
Thanks

 [‹ (x) Caribbean Reef Club - University Roman {Karl}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121162656/http:/www.typophile.com/node/5085 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Discover The Secrets - Classic Sans Serif {Steve Peter} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121162656/http:/www.typophile.com/node/5078 "Go to next forum topic")
author: anonymous

comments.content:
The closed counters of the c and e, along with the shape of the t, make me think this is a customized Helvetica.   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121162656im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/37452.jpg)
You could also try the House [Chalet](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121162656/http:/houseind.com/house.php?kit=CHALET-FO&sub=view) collection

Marc is right I think; very nice customization BTW. And   
good call on the House Chalet collection Patricia.
Thanks everyone. It does seem to be custom where the curve on the n and h don't match. I just thought it would be a nice find if it were a real font.

The "n" could well be an upside-down "u".   
   
Jeff
